intro: Hypochaeris meyeniana, commonly known as the meyenian weed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets and is known for its ability to spread rapidly through seeds. Hypochaeris meyeniana is often considered a weed due to its invasive tendencies in certain regions.
